bibl.title: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, October 10, 1940

div1.p: Hutchison is very interested in preserving the surviving Camp Lazear building.

div1.head: Letter from Ralph Cooper Hutchison to Philip Showalter Hench, October 10, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
October 10, 1940

div1.p:
Thank you very much for the hint in regard
to Doctor Sawyer. I am writing to him on another
matter and will be glad to put that in. It may
help the situation considerably.

I am most interested in the word concern-
ing the shack. It would be grand if that could be
determined and preserved. I think you have a good
man in Moran. I like the tone of his letter. He
sounds like a man who can do things.

Everything is going well and I hope we
will be ready, I hope, I hope.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Ralph Hutch Doctor Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
RCH/M
